013package org.apache.juneau.uon;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
017
018import java.lang.annotation.*;
019import java.nio.charset.*;
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.concurrent.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
029
030/**
031 * Serializes POJO models to UON (a notation for URL-encoded query parameter values).
032 *
033 * <h5 class='topic'>Media types</h5>
034 * <p>
035 * Handles <c>Accept</c> types:  <bc>text/uon</bc>
036 * <p>
037 * Produces <c>Content-Type</c> types:  <bc>text/uon</bc>
038 *
039 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
040 * <p>
041 * This serializer provides several serialization options.
042 * Typically, one of the predefined DEFAULT serializers will be sufficient.
043 * However, custom serializers can be constructed to fine-tune behavior.
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * The following shows a sample object defined in Javascript:
047 * <p class='bjson'>
048 *    {
049 *       id: 1,
050 *       name: <js>'John Smith'</js>,
051 *       uri: <js>'http://sample/addressBook/person/1'</js>,
052 *       addressBookUri: <js>'http://sample/addressBook'</js>,
053 *       birthDate: <js>'1946-08-12T00:00:00Z'</js>,
054 *       otherIds: <jk>null</jk>,
055 *       addresses: [
056 *          {
057 *             uri: <js>'http://sample/addressBook/address/1'</js>,
058 *             personUri: <js>'http://sample/addressBook/person/1'</js>,
059 *             id: 1,
060 *             street: <js>'100 Main Street'</js>,
061 *             city: <js>'Anywhereville'</js>,
062 *             state: <js>'NY'</js>,
063 *             zip: 12345,
064 *             isCurrent: <jk>true</jk>,
065 *          }
066 *       ]
067 *    }
068 * </p>
069 *
070 * <p>
071 * Using the "strict" syntax defined in this document, the equivalent UON notation would be as follows:
072 * <p class='buon'>
073 *    (
074 *       <ua>id</ua>=<un>1</un>,
075 *       <ua>name</ua>=<us>'John+Smith'</us>,
076 *       <ua>uri</ua>=<us>http://sample/addressBook/person/1</us>,
077 *       <ua>addressBookUri</ua>=<us>http://sample/addressBook</us>,
078 *       <ua>birthDate</ua>=<us>1946-08-12T00:00:00Z</us>,
079 *       <ua>otherIds</ua>=<uk>null</uk>,
080 *       <ua>addresses</ua>=@(
081 *          (
082 *             <ua>uri</ua>=<us>http://sample/addressBook/address/1</us>,
083 *             <ua>personUri</ua>=<us>http://sample/addressBook/person/1</us>,
084 *             <ua>id</ua>=<un>1</un>,
085 *             <ua>street</ua>=<us>'100+Main+Street'</us>,
086 *             <ua>city</ua>=<us>Anywhereville</us>,
087 *             <ua>state</ua>=<us>NY</us>,
088 *             <ua>zip</ua>=<un>12345</un>,
089 *             <ua>isCurrent</ua>=<uk>true</uk>
090 *          )
091 *       )
092 *    )
093 * </p>
094 *
095 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
096 * <p class='bjava'>
097 *    <jc>// Serialize a Map</jc>
098 *    Map <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>"{a:'b',c:1,d:false,e:['f',1,false],g:{h:'i'}}"</js>);
099 *
100 *    <jc>// Serialize to value equivalent to JSON.</jc>
101 *    <jc>// Produces "(a=b,c=1,d=false,e=@(f,1,false),g=(h=i))"</jc>
102 *    String <jv>uon</jv> = UonSerializer.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.serialize(<jv>map</jv>);
103 *
104 *    <jc>// Serialize a bean</jc>
105 *    <jk>public class</jk> Person {
106 *       <jk>public</jk> Person(String <jv>name</jv>);
107 *       <jk>public</jk> String getName();
108 *       <jk>public int</jk> getAge();
109 *       <jk>public</jk> Address getAddress();
110 *       <jk>public boolean</jk> deceased;
111 *    }
112 *
113 *    <jk>public class</jk> Address {
114 *       <jk>public</jk> String getStreet();
115 *       <jk>public</jk> String getCity();
116 *       <jk>public</jk> String getState();
117 *       <jk>public int</jk> getZip();
118 *    }
119 *
120 *    Person <jv>person</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Person(<js>"John Doe"</js>, 23, <js>"123 Main St"</js>, <js>"Anywhere"</js>,
121 *       <js>"NY"</js>, 12345, <jk>false</jk>);
122 *
123 *    <jc>// Produces "(name='John Doe',age=23,address=(street='123 Main St',city=Anywhere,state=NY,zip=12345),deceased=false)"</jc>
124 *    String <jv>uon</jv> = UonSerializer.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.serialize(<jv>person</jv>);
125 * </p>
126 *
127 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
128 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
129 * </ul>
130 *
131 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
132 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/UonBasics">UON Basics</a>
133
134 * </ul>
135 */
136public class UonSerializer extends WriterSerializer implements HttpPartSerializer, UonMetaProvider {
137
138   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
139   // Static
140   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
141
142   /** Reusable instance of {@link UonSerializer}, all default settings. */
143   public static final UonSerializer DEFAULT = new UonSerializer(create());
144
145   /** Reusable instance of {@link UonSerializer.Readable}. */
146   public static final UonSerializer DEFAULT_READABLE = new Readable(create());
147
148   /** Reusable instance of {@link UonSerializer.Encoding}. */
149   public static final UonSerializer DEFAULT_ENCODING = new Encoding(create());
150
151   /**
152    * Creates a new builder for this object.
153    *
154    * @return A new builder.
155    */
156   public static Builder create() {
157      return new Builder();
158   }
159
160   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
161   // Static subclasses
162   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
163
164   /**
165    * Equivalent to <code>UonSerializer.<jsm>create</jsm>().ws().build();</code>.
166    */
167   public static class Readable extends UonSerializer {
168
169      /**
170       * Constructor.
171       *
172       * @param builder The builder for this object.
173       */
174      public Readable(Builder builder) {
175         super(builder.useWhitespace());
176      }
177   }
178
179   /**
180    * Equivalent to <code>UonSerializer.<jsm>create</jsm>().encoding().build();</code>.
181    */
182   public static class Encoding extends UonSerializer {
183
184      /**
185       * Constructor.
186       *
187       * @param builder The builder for this object.
188       */
189      public Encoding(Builder builder) {
190         super(builder.encoding());
191      }
192   }
193
194   /**
195    * Converts the specified value to a string that can be used as an HTTP header value, query parameter value,
196    * form-data parameter, or URI path variable.
197    *
198    * <p>
199    * Returned values should NOT be URL-encoded.
200    *
201    * @param partType The category of value being serialized.
202    * @param schema
203    *    Schema information about the part.
204    *    <br>May be <jk>null</jk>.
205    *    <br>Not all part serializers use the schema information.
206    * @param value The value being serialized.
207    * @return The serialized value.
208    * @throws SerializeException If a problem occurred while trying to parse the input.
209    * @throws SchemaValidationException If the output fails schema validation.
210    */
211   public String serialize(HttpPartType partType, HttpPartSchema schema, Object value) throws SchemaValidationException, SerializeException {
212      return getPartSession().serialize(partType, schema, value);
213   }
214
215   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
216   // Builder
217   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
218
219   /**
220    * Builder class.
221    */
222   @FluentSetters
223   public static class Builder extends WriterSerializer.Builder {
224
225      private static final Cache<HashKey,UonSerializer> CACHE = Cache.of(HashKey.class, UonSerializer.class).build();
226
227      boolean addBeanTypesUon, encoding;
228      ParamFormat paramFormat;
229      Character quoteCharUon;
230
231      /**
232       * Constructor, default settings.
233       */
234      protected Builder() {
235         produces("text/uon");
236         addBeanTypesUon = env("UonSerializer.addBeanTypesUon", false);
237         encoding = env("UonSerializer.encoding", false);
238         paramFormat = env("UonSerializer.paramFormat", ParamFormat.UON);
239         quoteCharUon = null;
240      }
241
242      /**
243       * Copy constructor.
244       *
245       * @param copyFrom The bean to copy from.
246       */
247      protected Builder(UonSerializer copyFrom) {
248         super(copyFrom);
249         addBeanTypesUon = copyFrom.addBeanTypesUon;
250         encoding = copyFrom.encoding;
251         paramFormat = copyFrom.paramFormat;
252         quoteCharUon = copyFrom.quoteCharUon;
253      }
254
255      /**
256       * Copy constructor.
257       *
258       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy from.
259       */
260      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
261         super(copyFrom);
262         addBeanTypesUon = copyFrom.addBeanTypesUon;
263         encoding = copyFrom.encoding;
264         paramFormat = copyFrom.paramFormat;
265         quoteCharUon = copyFrom.quoteCharUon;
266      }
267
268      @Override /* Context.Builder */
269      public Builder copy() {
270         return new Builder(this);
271      }
272
273      @Override /* Context.Builder */
274      public UonSerializer build() {
275         return cache(CACHE).build(UonSerializer.class);
276      }
277
278      @Override /* Context.Builder */
279      public HashKey hashKey() {
280         return HashKey.of(
281            super.hashKey(),
282            addBeanTypesUon,
283            encoding,
284            paramFormat,
285            quoteCharUon
286         );
287      }
288
289      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
290      // Properties
291      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
292
293      /**
294       * Add <js>"_type"</js> properties when needed.
295       *
296       * <p>
297       * If <jk>true</jk>, then <js>"_type"</js> properties will be added to beans if their type cannot be inferred
298       * through reflection.
299       *
300       * <p>
301       * When present, this value overrides the {@link org.apache.juneau.serializer.Serializer.Builder#addBeanTypes()} setting and is
302       * provided to customize the behavior of specific serializers in a {@link SerializerSet}.
303       *
304       * @return This object.
305       */
306      @FluentSetter
307      public Builder addBeanTypesUon() {
308         return addBeanTypesUon(true);
309      }
310
311      /**
312       * Same as {@link #addBeanTypesUon()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
313       *
314       * @param value The value for this setting.
315       * @return This object.
316       */
317      @FluentSetter
318      public Builder addBeanTypesUon(boolean value) {
319         addBeanTypesUon = value;
320         return this;
321      }
322
323      /**
324       * Encode non-valid URI characters.
325       *
326       * <p>
327       * Encode non-valid URI characters with <js>"%xx"</js> constructs.
328       *
329       * <p>
330       * If <jk>true</jk>, non-valid URI characters will be converted to <js>"%xx"</js> sequences.
331       * <br>Set to <jk>false</jk> if parameter value is being passed to some other code that will already perform
332       * URL-encoding of non-valid URI characters.
333       *
334       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
335       * <p class='bjava'>
336       *    <jc>// Create a non-encoding UON serializer.</jc>
337       *    UonSerializer <jv>serializer1</jv> = UonSerializer.
338       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
339       *       .build();
340       *
341       *    <jc>// Create an encoding UON serializer.</jc>
342       *    UonSerializer <jv>serializer2</jv> = UonSerializer.
343       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
344       *       .encoding()
345       *       .build();
346       *
347       *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"foo bar"</js>);
348       *
349       *    <jc>// Produces: "(foo=foo bar)"</jc>
350       *    String <jv>uon1</jv> = <jv>serializer1</jv>.serialize(<jv>map</jv>)
351       *
352       *    <jc>// Produces: "(foo=foo%20bar)"</jc>
353       *    String <jv>uon2</jv> = <jv>serializer2</jv>.serialize(<jv>map</jv>)
354       * </p>
355       *
356       * @return This object.
357       */
358      @FluentSetter
359      public Builder encoding() {
360         return encoding(true);
361      }
362
363      /**
364       * Same as {@link #encoding()} but allows you to disable the previous setting.
365       *
366       * @param value The new value for this setting.
367       * @return This object.
368       */
369      public Builder encoding(boolean value) {
370         encoding = value;
371         return this;
372      }
373
374      /**
375       * Format to use for query/form-data/header values.
376       *
377       * <p>
378       * Specifies the format to use for URL GET parameter keys and values.
379       *
380       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
381       * <p class='bjava'>
382       *    <jc>// Create a normal UON serializer.</jc>
383       *    UonSerializer <jv>serializer1</jv> = UonSerializer
384       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
385       *       .build();
386       *
387       *    <jc>// Create a plain-text UON serializer.</jc>
388       *    UonSerializer <jv>serializer2</jv> = UonSerializer
389       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
390       *       .paramFormat(<jsf>PLAIN_TEXT</jsf>)
391       *       .build();
392       *
393       *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(
394       *       <js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>,
395       *       <js>"baz"</js>, <jk>new</jk> String[]{<js>"qux"</js>, <js>"true"</js>, <js>"123"</js>}
396       *    );
397       *
398       *    <jc>// Produces: "(foo=bar,baz=@(qux,'true','123'))"</jc>
399       *    String <jv>uon1</jv> = <jv>serializer1</jv>.serialize(<jv>map</jv>)
400       *
401       *    <jc>// Produces: "foo=bar,baz=qux,true,123"</jc>
402       *    String <jv>uon2</jv> = <jv>serializer2</jv>.serialize(<jv>map</jv>)
403       * </p>
404       *
405       * <p>
406       * <ul class='values javatree'>
407       *    <li class='jf'>{@link ParamFormat#UON} (default) - Use UON notation for parameters.
408       *    <li class='jf'>{@link ParamFormat#PLAINTEXT} - Use plain text for parameters.
409       * </ul>
410       *
411       * @param value
412       *    The new value for this property.
413       *    <br>The default value is {@link ParamFormat#UON}.
414       * @return This object.
415       */
416      @FluentSetter
417      public Builder paramFormat(ParamFormat value) {
418         paramFormat = value;
419         return this;
420      }
421
422      /**
423       * Format to use for query/form-data/header values.
424       *
425       * <p>
426       * Specifies plain-text for the format to use for URL GET parameter keys and values.
427       *
428       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
429       * <p class='bjava'>
430       *    <jc>// Create a plain-text UON serializer.</jc>
431       *    UonSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = UonSerializer
432       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
433       *       .paramFormatPlain()
434       *       .build();
435       *
436       *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(
437       *       <js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>,
438       *       <js>"baz"</js>, <jk>new</jk> String[]{<js>"qux"</js>, <js>"true"</js>, <js>"123"</js>}
439       *    );
440       *
441       *    <jc>// Produces: "foo=bar,baz=qux,true,123"</jc>
442       *    String <jv>uon</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>map</jv>)
443       * </p>
444       *
445       * @return This object.
446       */
447      @FluentSetter
448      public Builder paramFormatPlain() {
449         return paramFormat(ParamFormat.PLAINTEXT);
450      }
451
452      /**
453       * Specifies the quote character.
454       *
455       * @param value The value for this setting.
456       * @return This object.
457       */
458      @FluentSetter
459      public Builder quoteCharUon(char value) {
460         quoteCharUon = value;
461         return this;
462      }
463

494      }

1110
1111   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1112   // Instance
1113   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1114
1115   final boolean
1116      encoding,
1117      addBeanTypesUon;
1118   final ParamFormat
1119      paramFormat;
1120   final Character
1121      quoteCharUon;
1122
1123   private final boolean addBeanTypes;
1124   private final char quoteChar;
1125
1126   private final Map<ClassMeta<?>,UonClassMeta> uonClassMetas = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
1127   private final Map<BeanPropertyMeta,UonBeanPropertyMeta> uonBeanPropertyMetas = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
1128
1129   /**
1130    * Constructor.
1131    *
1132    * @param builder
1133    *    The builder for this object.
1134    */
1135   public UonSerializer(Builder builder) {
1136      super(builder);
1137
1138      encoding = builder.encoding;
1139      addBeanTypesUon = builder.addBeanTypesUon;
1140      paramFormat = builder.paramFormat;
1141      quoteCharUon = builder.quoteCharUon;
1142
1143      addBeanTypes = addBeanTypesUon || super.isAddBeanTypes();
1144      quoteChar = quoteCharUon != null ? quoteCharUon : super.quoteChar() != null ? super.quoteChar() : '\'';
1145   }
1146
1147   @Override /* Context */
1148   public Builder copy() {
1149      return new Builder(this);
1150   }
1151
1152   @Override /* Context */
1153   public  UonSerializerSession.Builder createSession() {
1154      return UonSerializerSession.create(this);
1155   }
1156
1157   @Override /* Context */
1158   public UonSerializerSession getSession() {
1159      return createSession().build();
1160   }
1161
1162   @Override /* HttpPartSerializer */
1163   public UonSerializerSession getPartSession() {
1164      return UonSerializerSession.create(this).build();
1165   }
1166
1167   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1168   // Extended metadata
1169   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1170
1171   @Override /* UonMetaProvider */
1172   public UonClassMeta getUonClassMeta(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
1173      UonClassMeta m = uonClassMetas.get(cm);
1174      if (m == null) {
1175         m = new UonClassMeta(cm, this);
1176         uonClassMetas.put(cm, m);
1177      }
1178      return m;
1179   }
1180
1181   @Override /* UonMetaProvider */
1182   public UonBeanPropertyMeta getUonBeanPropertyMeta(BeanPropertyMeta bpm) {
1183      if (bpm == null)
1184         return UonBeanPropertyMeta.DEFAULT;
1185      UonBeanPropertyMeta m = uonBeanPropertyMetas.get(bpm);
1186      if (m == null) {
1187         m = new UonBeanPropertyMeta(bpm.getDelegateFor(), this);
1188         uonBeanPropertyMetas.put(bpm, m);
1189      }
1190      return m;
1191   }
1192
1193   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1194   // Properties
1195   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1196
1197   /**
1198    * Add <js>"_type"</js> properties when needed.
1199    *
1200    * @see Builder#addBeanTypesUon()
1201    * @return
1202    *    <jk>true</jk> if <js>"_type"</js> properties will be added to beans if their type cannot be inferred
1203    *    through reflection.
1204    */
1205   @Override
1206   protected final boolean isAddBeanTypes() {
1207      return addBeanTypes;
1208   }
1209
1210   /**
1211    * Encode non-valid URI characters.
1212    *
1213    * @see Builder#encoding()
1214    * @return
1215    *    <jk>true</jk> if non-valid URI characters should be encoded with <js>"%xx"</js> constructs.
1216    */
1217   protected final boolean isEncoding() {
1218      return encoding;
1219   }
1220
1221   /**
1222    * Format to use for query/form-data/header values.
1223    *
1224    * @see Builder#paramFormat(ParamFormat)
1225    * @return
1226    *    Specifies the format to use for URL GET parameter keys and values.
1227    */
1228   protected final ParamFormat getParamFormat() {
1229      return paramFormat;
1230   }
1231
1232   /**
1233    * Quote character.
1234    *
1235    * @see Builder#quoteCharUon(char)
1236    * @return
1237    *    The character used for quoting attributes and values.
1238    */
1239   @Override
1240   protected final char getQuoteChar() {
1241      return quoteChar;
1242   }
1243
1244   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1245   // Other methods
1246   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1247
1248   @Override /* Context */
1249   protected JsonMap properties() {
1250      return filteredMap("encoding", encoding, "addBeanTypes", addBeanTypes, "paramFormat", paramFormat);
1251   }
